kpi_info.title: period_duration (period_duration)
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: GR_UAS_IMA (M514C0)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds of IMA Group. An interval when the IMA group is unable to transfer cells. The number of one second intervals when the Group Traffic State Machine (GTSM) is down. UPDATED: The counter is uppdated for every second that the IMA group is unavailable.

kpi_info.title: GR_FC (M514C1)
kpi_info.use: The number of Near End group failure condition in the IMA Group. The number of possible Near End group failure alarms when conditions are config-abort and there are insufficient links. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when Config-Aborted (the FE tries to use unacceptable configuration parameters) or Insufficient-Links (when less than the minimum number of transmit (PTx) or receive (PRx) links are Active) conditions occur.

kpi_info.title: IV_IMA1 (M514C3)
kpi_info.use: ICP violations of the IMA link. The number of errored, invalid or missing IMA Control Protocol (ICP) cells on an IMA link, except during seconds where a SES-IMA or UAS-I MA condition is reported. UPDATED:When an ICP violation is detected. The counter is updated when a cell with good HEC, CRC and CID is received. This means that the ICP is in the expected frame position with unexpected IMA OAM Label, unexpected LID, unexpected IMA ID, unexpected IMA frame number, unexpected ICP cell offset, or the received M not equal to the expected M of the IMA group.

kpi_info.title: SES_IMA1 (M514C4)
kpi_info.use: Severely errored seconds at near end of IMA link. The number of one second intervals at Near End containing >=30% of the ICP cells counted as IV-IMA or one or more link defects (e.g. LOS, OOF/LOF, AIS or LCD), LIF or LODS defects. This does not include defects during UAS-IMA condition. UPDATED: SES_IMA counter is updated (meaning that a second is defined as a severely errored second) when 30 % or more of the ICP cells received from the link are err ored. The errored ICP cells are counted as errored according to the IV-IMA (IV is ICP cell violation) definition. Also the more severe errors in the link, such as LOS, OOF/L OF, AIS, LCD, LIF or LODS, automatically cause the second to be considered as severely errored.

kpi_info.title: SES_IMA_FE1 (M514C5)
kpi_info.use: Severely errored seconds at far end of IMA link. The number of one second intervals at Far End containing one or more RDI-IMA defects. This does not include defects during USA-IMA-FE conditions. UPDATED: The counter is uppdated when one or more RDI-IMA defects are detected.

kpi_info.title: UAS_IMA1 (M514C6)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at Near End of IMA link. At the Near End the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA. This includes the first t en seconds to enter the UAS-IMA condition and ends at the start of the first ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS-IMA condition. UPDATED: A count of 1-second intervals for which the near end IMA link is unavailable. The near end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the near end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMAs. The 10 s econds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time.

kpi_info.title: UAS_IMA_FE1 (M514C7)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at the far end of the IMA link. At the far end the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA-FE. This includes the fi rst ten seconds to enter the UAS-IMA-FE condition and ends at the start of ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA-FE. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS-IMA-FE condition. UPDATED:A count of 1-second intervals for which the far end IMA link is unavailable. The far end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 conti guous SES-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the far end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMAs. The 10 seconds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time.

kpi_info.title: TX_UUS_IMA1 (M514C8)
kpi_info.use: Tx unusable seconds at the near end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Near End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IM A link is unable to transfer traffic. UPDATED:The counter is updated when a link is unusable: the link is configured, but not in use because of a fault, inhibition, etc. The re are many reasons for transmit link states: test failed (mis-connectivity has been found as a result of a test), Fault (a fault has been detected either on the link or in the link protocol), Inhibited (the operation of the link is blocked because of a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason. Otherwise, the lin k may be used.

kpi_info.title: RX_UUS_IMA1 (M514C9)
kpi_info.use: Rx unusable seconds at the near end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Near End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IM A link is unable to receive traffic. UPDATED:Unusable means that the link is configured, but cannot be used. The receive link states include: idle (insufficient information to start link establishment), failed (the receiver has failed because of the persistence of a defined defect(examples of defects are LCD, LIF, and LODS)), inhibited (the ope ration of the link is blocked because of a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason (the link may be used for testing)).

kpi_info.title: TX_UUS_IMA_FE1 (M514C10)
kpi_info.use: Tx unusable seconds at the far end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Far End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IMA link is unable to transfer traffic. UPDATED:The counter is updated when a link is unusable: the link is configured, but not in use because of a fault, inhibition, etc. There are many reasons for the transmit link state: Test failed (mis-connectivity has been found as a result of a test), Fault (a fault has been detected either on the link or in the link protocol), Inhibited (the operation of the link is blocked because of a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason. Otherwise, the li nk may be used.

kpi_info.title: RX_UUS_IMA_FE1 (M514C11)
kpi_info.use: Rx unusable seconds at the far end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Far End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IMA link is unable to receive traffic. UPDATED:Unusable means that the link is configured, but cannot be used. The receive link states include: idle (insufficient information to start link establishment), failed (the receiver has failed because of the persistence of a defined defect (examples of defects are LCD, LIF, and LODS)), inhibited (the oper ation of the link is blocked for a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason (the link may be used for testing)).

kpi_info.title: TX_FC1 (M514C12)
kpi_info.use: Near End Tx link failure of the IMA link. The number of Near End Tx link failures (Tx-misconnected and Tx-Fault alarm condition entries.) Not in use, the counter value is always zero. UPDATED: Not updated.

kpi_info.title: RX_FC1 (M514C13)
kpi_info.use: Near End Rx link failure count of IMA link. The number of Near End Rx link failures, Loss of IMA Frame (LIF), Link Out of Delay Synchronization (LODS) and Rx-Fault alarm condition entries. UPDATED:When the Rx link is detected as misconnected. This is reported when the IMA unit has determined that the Rx link is not connected to the same FE IMA unit as the othe r Rx links in the group.

kpi_info.title: IV_IMA2 (M514C15)
kpi_info.use: CP violations of IMA link. The count of errored, invalid or missing IMA Control Protocol (ICP) cells on an IMA link, except during seconds where a SES-IMA or UAS-IMA conditi on is reported. UPDATED:The counter is incremented When an ICP violation is detected. The counter is updated when a cell with good HEC, CRC and CID is received. It means ICP at the expected frame position with unexpected IMA OAM Label or unexpected LID or unexpected IMA ID or received M not equal to expected M of the IMA group or unexpected IMA frame number or unexpected ICP cell offset.

kpi_info.title: SES_IMA2 (M514C16)
kpi_info.use: Severely errored seconds at near end of IMA link. The number of one second intervals at Near End containing >=30% of the ICP cells counted as IV-IMA or one o r more link defects (for example LOS, OOF/LOF, AIS or LCD), LIF or LODS defects. This does not include defects during UAS-IMA condition. UPDATED:SES_IMA counter is updated ( meaning that a second is defined as a severely errored second) when 30% or more of the ICP cells received from the link are errored. The errored ICP cells are counted as err ored according to the IV-IMA (IV is ICP cell violation) definition. Also the more severe errors in the link, such as LOS, OOF/LOF,AIS,LCD,LIF or LODS, automatically cause th e second to be considered as severely errored

kpi_info.title: SES_IMA_FE2 (M514C17)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at Near End of IMA link. At the Near End the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA. This includes the first ten s econds to enter the UAS-IMA condition and ends at the start of the first ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS- IMA condition. UPDATED:A count of 1-second intervals for which the near end IMA link is unavailable. The near end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the near end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-I MAs. The 10 seconds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time

kpi_info.title: UAS_IMA2 (M514C18)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at Near End of IMA link. At the Near End the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA. This includes the first ten s econds to enter the UAS-IMA condition and ends at the start of the first ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS- IMA condition. UPDATED:A count of 1-second intervals for which the near end IMA link is unavailable. The near end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the near end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-I MAs. The 10 seconds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time.

kpi_info.title: UAS_IMA_FE2 (M514C19)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at Far End of IMA link. At the Far End the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA-FE. This includes the first ten seconds to enter the UAS-IMA-FE condition and ends at the start of ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA-FE. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS-IMA -FE condition. UPDATED:A count of 1-second intervals for which the far end IMA link is unavailable. The far end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 contiguous SE S-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the far end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMAs . The 10 seconds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time.

kpi_info.title: TX_FC2 (M514C24)
kpi_info.use: Near End Tx link failure of the IMA link. The number of Near End Tx link failures (Tx-misconnected and Tx-Fault alarm condition entries). Not in use, the counter value i s always zero. UPDATED:Not updated

This is reported when the IMA unit has determined that the Rx link is not connected to the same FE IMA unit as the other Rx links in the group.

kpi_info.title: IV_IMA5 (M514C51)
kpi_info.use: ICP violations of IMA link. The count of errored, invalid or missing IMA Control Protocol (ICP) cells on an IMA link, except during seconds where a SES-IMA or UAS-IMA co ndition is reported. UPDATED:The counter is incremented When an ICP violation is detected. The counter is updated when a cell with good HEC, CRC and CID is received. It mean s ICP at the expected frame position with unexpected IMA OAM Label or unexpected LID or unexpected IMA ID or received M not equal to expected M of the IMA group or unexpecte d IMA frame number or unexpected ICP cell offset.

kpi_info.title: SES_IMA5 (M514C52)
kpi_info.use: Severely errored seconds at near end of IMA link. The number of one second intervals at Near End containing >=30% of the ICP cells counted as IV-IMA or one or more link defects (for example LOS, OOF/LOF, AIS or LCD), LIF or LODS defects. This does not include defects during UAS-IMA condition. UPDATED:SES_IMA counter is updated (meaning that a second is defined as a severely errored second) when 30% or more of the ICP cells received from the link are errored. The errored ICP cells are counted as errored accordi ng to the IV-IMA (IV is ICP cell violation) definition. Also the more severe errors in the link, such as LOS, OOF/LOF,AIS,LCD,LIF or LODS, automatically cause the second to be considered as severely errored.

kpi_info.title: SES_IMA_FE5 (M514C53)
kpi_info.use: Severely errored seconds at far end of IMA link. The number of one second intervals at Far End containing one or more RDI-IMA defects. This does not include defects duri ng UAS-IMA-FE conditions. UPDATED:The counter is updated when one or more RDI-IMA defects are detected.

kpi_info.title: UAS_IMA5 (M514C54)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at Near End of IMA link. At the Near End the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA. This includes the first ten s econds to enter the UAS-IMA condition and ends at the start of the first ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS- IMA condition. UPDATED:A count of 1-second intervals for which the near end IMA link is unavailable. The near end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 contiguous SES-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the near end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-I MAs. The 10 seconds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time.

kpi_info.title: UAS_IMA_FE5 (M514C55)
kpi_info.use: Unavailable seconds at Far End of IMA link. At the Far End the period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES-IMA-FE. This includes the first ten seconds to enter the UAS-IMA-FE condition and ends at the start of ten consecutive seconds with no SES-IMA-FE. This does not include the last ten seconds to exit the UAS-IMA -FE condition. UPDATED:A count of 1-second intervals for which the far end IMA link is unavailable. The far end IMA link becomes unavailable at the onset of 10 contiguous SE S-IMAs. The 10 SES-IMAs are included in the unavailable time. Once unavailable, the far end IMA link becomes available at the onset of 10 contiguous seconds with no SES-IMAs . The 10 seconds with no SES-IMAs are excluded from the unavailable time.

kpi_info.title: TX_UUS_IMA5 (M514C56)
kpi_info.use: Tx unusable seconds at the near end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Near End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IM A link is unable to transfer traffic. UPDATED:The counter is updated when a link is unusable: the link is configured, but not in use because of a fault, inhibition, etc. The re are many reasons for transmit link states: test failed (mis-connectivity has been found as a result of a test), Fault (a fault has been detected either on the link or in the link protocol), Inhibited (the operation of the link is blocked because of a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason. Otherwise, the lin k may be used.

kpi_info.title: RX_UUS_IMA5 (M514C57)
kpi_info.use: Rx unusable seconds at the near end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Near End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IM A link is unable to receive traffic. UPDATED:Unusable means that the link is configured, but cannot be used. The receive link states include: idle (insufficient information to start link establishment), failed (the receiver has failed because of the persistence of a defined defect(examples of defects are LCD, LIF, and LODS)), inhibited (the ope ration of the link is blocked because of a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason (the link may be used for testing)).

kpi_info.title: TX_UUS_IMA_FE5 (M514C58)
kpi_info.use: Tx unusable seconds at the far end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Far End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IMA link is unable to transfer traffic. UPDATED:The counter is updated when a link is unusable: the link is configured, but not in use because of a fault, inhibition, etc. There are many reasons for the transmit link state: Test failed (mis-connectivity has been found as a result of a test), Fault (a fault has been detected either on the link or in the link protocol), Inhibited (the operation of the link is blocked because of a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason. Otherwise, the li nk may be used.

kpi_info.title: RX_UUS_IMA_FE5 (M514C59)
kpi_info.use: Rx unusable seconds at the far end of the IMA link. The number of seconds that the Far End Link State Machine (LSM) is in the 'unusable' state, which means that the IMA link is unable to receive traffic. UPDATED:Unusable means that the link is configured, but cannot be used. The receive link states include: idle (insufficient information to start link establishment), failed (the receiver has failed because of the persistence of a defined defect (examples of defects are LCD, LIF, and LODS)), inhibited (the oper ation of the link is blocked for a locally defined application-dependent or implementation-dependent reason (the link may be used for testing)).

kpi_info.title: TX_FC5 (M514C60)
kpi_info.use: Near End Tx link failure of the IMA link. The number of Near End Tx link failures (Tx-misconnected and Tx-Fault alarm condition entries). Not in use, the counter value i s always zero. UPDATED:Not updated.

kpi_info.title: RX_FC5 (M514C61)
kpi_info.use: ear End Rx link failure count of IMA link. The number of Near End Rx link failures, Loss of IMA Frame (LIF), Link Out of Delay Synchronization (LODS) and Rx-Fault alarm condition entries. UPDATED:When the Rx link is detected as misconnected. This is reported when the IMA unit has determined that the Rx link is not connected to the same FE I MA unit as the other Rx links in the group.

It mean s ICP at the expected frame position with unexpected IMA OAM Label or unexpected LID or unexpected IMA ID or received M not equal to expected M of the IMA group or unexpecte d IMA frame number or unexpected ICP cell offset.
